top_categories.workout_context: Giro Sardegna Gravel’s sardinian mountains gravel (75%), paved roads (25%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Giro Sardegna Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Giro Sardegna Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 81 miles, Giro Sardegna Gravel punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Giro Sardegna Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Giro Sardegna Gravel’s sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal views and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Giro Sardegna Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Giro Sardegna Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Giro Sardegna Gravel’s 8,530ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Giro Sardegna Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal views.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Giro Sardegna Gravel’s sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal views delivers on race day.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Giro Sardegna Gravel’s 8,530ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Giro Sardegna Gravel’s 81 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Giro Sardegna Gravel demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal views at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: sardinian mountains gravel (75%), paved roads (25%), rolling terrain. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 81 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 81 miles of sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal views in Siniscola, Sardinia, Italy.
